content:
• Monday, June 23, 2014
  • DF

    Dean Foods reportedly subpoenaed in Icahn/Mickelson case

    • The WSJ reports criminal authorities have subpoenaed Dean Foods (NYSE:DF) over an insider trading probe that covers Carl Icahn, Phil Mickelson, and sports bettor William T. Walters.
    • Investigators are reportedly probing whether Walters provided tips related to Dean Foods to Mickelson. They're also probing whether Icahn tipped Walters about planned trading in Clorox.
    • Both the FBI and SEC are said to be involved.
    • DF -7.4% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    Apple roundup: iPhone 6 production, Touch ID, OIS

    • Taiwan's Economic Daily News reports Foxconn is in the midst of hiring 100K workers to help ramp iPhone 6 (AAPL -0.1%) production. Fellow ODM Pegatron is also said to be ramping iPhone-related hiring.
    • Foxconn is said to be handling 70% of production for the iPhone 6, which is expected to tap into pent-up demand for bigger iPhones. Apple is reportedly trying to get carriers to agree to a price hike. Cirrus Logic (CRUS +2.8%) has closed higher following the report.
    • China Times reports TSMC (TSM -1.4%) is expected to produce 120M Touch ID fingerprint sensors this year, up over 3x from last year. Next-gen iPad models are expected to support Touch ID, which was just opened up to iOS developers.
    • Following an Asian trip, Pac Crest believes the 5.5" iPhone 6 will support optical image stabilization (OIS). The firm also backs up VentureBeat by expressing confidence the iPhone 6 will support wireless charging and NFC.
    • Sony, LG, and Nokia have included OIS in high-end smartphone models, and Samsung is expected to do so in upcoming phones. Pac Crest's report follows the release of API data suggesting iOS 8 supports manual camera controls.
    • Update: Bloomberg reports iPhone 6 mass-production will start in July, and that both the 4.7" and 5.5" models might arrive in September.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM | 24 Comments

  • After hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: HERO +5.1%. ZPIN +3.9%. SNHY +3.7%. CLDX +3.6%. CXDC +3.4%.
    • Top losers, as of 5:15 p.m.: TSLA -3.2%. AMBA -3.0%. UBNT -3.0%. YNDX -2.9%. SCTY -2.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 8 Comments
  • KNOP

    KNOT Offshore to buy shuttle tankers, funded by 4.6M-unit offering

    • KNOT Offshore Partners (NYSE:KNOP) -7.9% AH on news it plans a public offering of 4.6M common units, with an underwriters' option to purchase an additional 690K common units.
    • KNOP says it will use the proceeds to fund the purchase of two shuttle tankers from Knutsen NYK Offshore Tankers, with the remainder for general partnership purposes.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM
  • MELI

    MercadoLibre -1.9% AH on $300M convertible offering

    • MercadoLibre (NASDAQ:MELI) plans to sell $300M worth of convertible senior notes due 2019. Initial purchasers are expected to have a $30M overallotment option.
    • The Latin American e-commerce leader had $264M in cash/investments at the end of Q1, and just $9.5M in debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM | 1 Comment
  • HLT

    Blackstone lightening up on Hilton and Brixmor stakes

    • Hilton Worldwide (NYSE:HLT) launches a 90M share secondary offering to accommodate a sale by Blackstone (NYSE:BX) and affiliates.
    • Shares -0.6% AH
    • Previously: Brixmor insiders selling 25M shares
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • BRX

    Brixmor insiders selling 25M shares

    • Brixmor Property Group (NYSE:BRX) announces a secondary offering of 25M shares from certain selling stockholders (Blackstone and affiliates). The underwriter greenshoe is for 3.75M shares.
    • BRX -2.8% AH
    • See also: Blackstone lightening up on Hilton and Brixmor stakes
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • NLSN

    Rocket Fuel jumps after launching ad solution with Nielsen/comScore

    • Rocket Fuel Audience Guarantee leverages real-time "optimization inputs" from top audience measurement data providers Nielsen (NLSN +0.2%) and comScore (SCOR +0.1%) to improve ad targeting for brand marketers.
    • Rocket Fuel (FUEL +8.9%) already uses A.I.-based algorithms and giant datasets to predict user responses to different ad types, and thus figure out out which ads to deliver. Nielsen/comScore's data, already used by the likes of Google and Facebook, will augment those capabilities
    • Short-covering likely contributed to today's huge gains: 24% of the float was shorted as of May 30.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • SONC

    Sonic beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Sonic (NASDAQ:SONC): FQ3 EPS of $0.30 beats by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $152.18M (+3.8% Y/Y) beats by $3.63M.
    • Shares +2.03% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • FNF

    Fidelity National-owned Comdata could be worth more than $3B

    • Behind the (now mostly erased) spike in Fidelity National Financial (FNF +1%) is a WSJ article speculating Comdata - jointly owned by Thomas H. Lee Partners and FNF - could fetch more than $3B in a sale.
    • Comdata earlier this year filed for an IPO, but the plans have morphed into a "dual-track" process after potential buyers came sniffing around.
    • Based in Tennessee, Comdata processes purchase, payroll, and accounts payable for companies. It also processes more than 1B transactions each year for corporate gift card and loyalty programs.
    • Previously: Quick spike higher in Fidelity National
     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM
  • MILL

    Miller Energy brings WMRU-2 well online with better than expected results

    • Miller Energy (MILL +4.4%) moves up after reporting it successfully brought online its WMRU-2 sidetrack well in Alaska, with production averaging ~630 boe/day during its first week.
    • The well increases the WMRU field-wide production by more than 50%, and the initial production rate is substantially above expectations, MILL says.
    • CEO Scott Boruff says the transformation of the well will be a substantial revenue generator for the oil and natural gas explorer.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • ORBC

    Orbcomm drops after SpaceX launch delayed

    • Elon Musk's SpaceX has delayed the launch of its Falcon 9 rocket (originally set for Sunday) until at least Tuesday after a potential problem was detected during pre-flight testing.
    • Falcon 9 is meant to put six Orbcomm (ORBC -5.2%) communications satellites into orbit, thereby boosting Orbcomm's messaging capacity and transfer speeds.
    • Orbcomm is paying SpaceX $42.6M for two Falcon 9 launches. The second one, which will carry 11 satellites, is due before year's end.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • VALE

    Vale gains on China PMI, but Credit Suisse cuts iron ore outlook

    • Vale (VALE +2.2%) is higher after China reported better than expected June flash manufacturing PMI data, but while iron ore prices may incrementally firm up from Chinese demand, Credit Suisse cuts its iron ore price outlook as it does not foresee any real strength ahead without the kind of broad based stimulus package the current Chinese administration has disavowed.
    • The firm now forecasts iron ore to average only $90/ton in H2 of this year, and expects prices to average $89/ton next year and $87/ton in 2016.
    • Plus, the big three Australian miners - Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO), BHP and Fortescue Metals (OTCQX:FSUMF) - are racing to expand production this year before Vale begins to contribute more meaningfully in 2015, meaning plenty of overseas supply should be expected.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 12 Comments
  • DDD

    3D printing stocks post big gains

    • Momentum traders are warming up to 3D printing stocks again: 3D Systems (DDD +5.4%), Stratasys (SSYS +3.9%), and Voxeljet (VJET +8%) are up sharply, though no major news has arrived to fuel a rally. ExOne (XONE +2.9%), Camtek (CAMT +5.5%), and Organovo (ONVO +2.8%) are also higher.
    • 3D Systems is at its highest levels since May, and Stratasys and Voxeljet their highest levels since April.
    • YTD performance for the group remains weak, thanks in large part to earnings disappointments and the valuation concerns that followed monster 2013 rallies. 3D Systems -40%, Stratasys -21%, Voxeljet -57%, ExOne -40%, Camtek -18%, Organovo -32%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM | 9 Comments
  • OPEN

    OPEN reportedly talked with bidders other than PCLN; YELP, LIVE gain

    • Sources tell dealReporter OpenTable (OPEN +0.1%) talked with bidders other than Priceline (PCLN -0.1%) before accepting the online travel giant's $2.6B bid.
    • Though a higher offer is seen as unlikely, one source thinks Yahoo (set to receive an Alibaba IPO windfall) could make a bid. OpenTable is currently 1.9% above Priceline's $103/share offer price.
    • Yelp (YELP +3.6%), which blasted off after Priceline/OpenTable was announced, is rallying again. Volatile restaurant deals microcap LiveDeal (LIVE +9.3%) is also up strongly.
    • Previous: Street commentary on Priceline/OpenTable
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM
  • ARUN

    Aruba, Ruckus, Ubiquiti, Aerohive gain after FCC/Senate Wi-Fi moves

    • FCC chairman Tom Wheeler has unveiled a plan to spend $1B/year in 2015 and 2016 to install Wi-Fi networks in U.S. schools and libraries, through the government's E-Rate program. Last year, no E-Rate funds were available for Wi-Fi.
    • Meanwhile, Senators Marco Rubio and Cory Booker have introduced a bill that calls on the FCC explore opening up 75MHz. (5850-5925MHz.) for commercial Wi-Fi use. The auto industry isn't crazy about the idea, given the band is already set to be used to enable car-to-car communication.
    • In March, the FCC committed to opening up 100MHz. of 5GHz.-band spectrum previously used by satellite phone companies for Wi-Fi use.
    • Enterprise/carrier Wi-Fi equipment vendors Aruba (ARUN +3.1%), Ruckus (RKUS +4.4%), Ubiquiti (UBNT +3.7%), and Aerohive (HIVE +1.2%) are all trading higher following the latest announcements. Ruckus might also be getting a lift from news of deals with hotel owners La Quinta and Scandic.
    • The FCC/Senate moves come ahead of the mass adoption of the HotSpot 2.0 standard, which is expected to boost public and carrier Wi-Fi usage by allowing devices to automatically log into hotspots.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 2 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Top 10 Gainers: AGRX +31%. CAW +25%. NSPH +19%. TGD +16%. NEO +15%. OHRP +14%. TBIO +13%. TEG +13%. RMGN +12%. HNNA +10%.
    • Top 10 Losers: OTC:PRKR -55%. AAMC -20%. MTOR -13%. INPH -12%. HOTR -10%. AGIO -10%. RESI -10%. OTC:IGC -9%. CNCE -9%. OTC:PVCT -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • MON

    Syngenta, Monsanto spike on report they weighed $40B deal

    • Monsanto (MON +0.4%) recently explored a takeover of Swiss rival Syngenta (SYT +5.1%) in a potential $40B deal that would have allowed the U.S. firm to move its tax location to Switzerland, according to a Bloomberg report.
    • The two companies held preliminary talks with advisers in recent months about a combination before SYT decided against negotiations, the report says; while talks are currently on hold, sources say the deal could be revived.
    • MON jumped to a new all-time high at $123.99, and has since pulled back to ~$122.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 13 Comments
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto's Oyu Tolgoi mine faces new audit claiming unpaid taxes, penalties

    • Rio Tinto's (RIO +1.8%) $6.2B Oyu Tolgoi copper and gold project in Mongolia hits another snag, as Turquoise Hill Resources (TRQ -4.1%), the Rio-owned mining company that owns the rights to the mine, is handed a new audit claiming unpaid taxes and penalties.
    • TRQ says it disputes the government's claims and that a failure to resolve the issue before the end of the month could jeopardize the mine's next phase of development.
    • RIO and TRQ say they may consider taking Mongolia to international arbitration if they decide the new tax claim amounts to a breach of their investment agreement.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 5 Comments
  • RGSE

    RGS Energy +7.2% on NYC solar deal

    • RGS Energy (NASDAQ:RGSE) has been hired to design and install 1MW worth of solar systems for a 60-acre residential co-op in Queens' Kew Garden Hills neighborhood.
    • Construction is expected to start in Q3, and finish before year's end. The deal comes two months after RGS scored a contract for a 2.6MW Massachusetts solar system.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • KBH

    KB Home gains ahead of earnings

    • Leading the homebuilders higher in today's session is KB Home (KBH +1.6%) which is set to release quarterly results on Thursday. RBC Capital - which has an Outperform rating on the stock - sees strong revenues, gross margin expansion, and solid price increases.
    • Also reporting this week (Wednesday) is Lennar.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM | 2 Comments
  • QIWI

    Qiwi drops following fresh sanctions threat

    • EU foreign ministers are threatening to impose fresh sanctions on Russia if it doesn't cooperate with Ukraine's proposed peace plan and halt the flow of arms and fighters across its border. Qiwi (QIWI -3.5%) shares dipped following the announcement.
    • Separately, the Russian online payments leader announced this morning it had closed its 7.97M-share offering (previous). Qiwi sold 1.99M new shares, and 5.98M shares on behalf of existing holders, at $40 apiece (4% above current levels).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • HRG

    Harbinger offers to buy Central Garden & Pet

    • Harbinger Group (HRG +1%), Phil Falcone's holding company, offers to buy retailer Central Garden & Pet (CENT +8.9%) in a ~$1.1B deal that includes the assumption of debt, or - as an alternative to acquiring the entire company - purchase CENT's pet business for $750M.
    • CENT operates two segments: Its lawn-and-garden business offers grass seed, weed killer and flower pots, while its pet-supply unit sells dog bones, horse vitamins and aquariums.
    • HRG says it has tried unsuccessfully to engage CENT in closed-door talks, and that it decided to make its offer public in light of the lack of response.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAMC

    Running out of distressed assets? Altisource Asset Management falls sharply

    • Tanking alongside Altisource Residential is Altisource Asset Management (AAMC -18.7%) which provides asset management services to Altisource Residential.
    • As previously reported, Altisource Residential (and others) were shut out of this month's HUD auction of troubled mortgages after Lone Star scooped up the entire offering at a pretty fancy price.
    • Others in the family: Ocwen Financial (OCN +1.9%), Altisource Portfolio Solutions (ASPS +0.3%), Home Loan Servicing Solutions (HLSS -0.1%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 3 Comments
  • INVN

    InvenSense gains on bullish Pac Crest, OTR Global notes

    • Following an Asian trip, Pac Crest's John Vinh has upped his InvenSense (INVN +3.9%) PT by $4 to $26.
    • Like Craig-Hallum, Vinh thinks it's possible InvenSense has landed the iPhone 6's gyroscope slot. He also thinks the company might have iPhone 6 OIS and iWatch design wins.
    • Vinh had recently reported InvenSense's OIS products are making headway at top customer Samsung. CEO Behrooz Abdi stated in May InvenSense's OIS products had seen "quite a bit of adoption," but cautioned design wins with tier-1 OEMs could take time.
    • OTR Global is also out with a bullish note on InvenSense. Shares are at their highest levels since April.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 3 Comments
  • GRPN

    Groupon rallies; Piper reports deal count continues to grow

    • Piper's deal-tracking data indicates the number of deals on Groupon's (GRPN +4.1%) site is steadily growing.
    • Groupon had 200K+ active deals (95K+ in North America) at the end of Q1, up from 140K+ at the end of Q4. The company has been trying hard to cut its dependence on traditional daily deals e-mails by building a giant e-commerce marketplace (available through its site and apps) of searchable deals and goods.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • NAO

    Leon Cooperman reports 21.8% stake in Nordic American Offshore

    • Nordic American Offshore (NAO +8.4%) shoots higher after Leon Cooperman reported a beneficial ownership stake of ~4.9M shares, or ~21.8%, in the supplier of offshore energy vessels that went public earlier this month.
    • Separately, NAO says it has ordered two newbuilding platform supply vessels, increasing its fleet to 10 PSVs during Q2 and Q3 2015; the vessels are particularly well suited for operations in the North Sea and in cold climate conditions.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • PRKR

    ParkerVision down 65.3% after resuming trading

    • ParkerVision (OTC:PRKR) has cratered after receiving an unfavorable ruling from the Florida district court handling the company's original IP suit against Qualcomm.
    • In an official statement, ParkerVision confirms Qualcomm's motions for a JMOL and a new trial regarding non-infringement were granted, while adding its motions for a JMOL and new trial regarding patent invalidity were denied. All other motions were denied as moot.
    • ParkerVision: "While we are pleased that the court upheld the jury's decision that the patents are valid, we are obviously disappointed with the District Court's ruling that judgment be entered for Qualcomm on non-infringement." Not surprisingly, the company will appeal the non-infringement ruling.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • RESI

    Altisource Residential tumbles after losing out on HUD auction

    • P-E firm Lone Star won this month's HUD auction of distressed loans with a $3.9B bid, or 65.8% of the unpaid loan balances.
    • The easy money may have turned into the "winner's curse," with a HUD spokesman noting this month's auction "was the most competitive sale to date" - a total of 27 bidders submitting 163 bids. Average winning bids two years ago were about 50% of property values vs. this month's 77.6%.
    • Altisource Residential (RESI -8.2%), had been winning auctions at bids well lower than 77.6% of property values.
    • See also: Running out of distressed assets? Altisource Asset Management falls sharply
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • TDC

    Teradata drops on JMP downgrade

    • JMP has cut Teradata (TDC -2.7%) to Market Perform. The firm is worried platforms such as the Hadoop big data framework, Amazon's Redshift data warehousing service, and NoSQL databases will limit the data warehousing hardware/software vendor's growth.
    • Teradata has been beset by Hadoop concerns for some time. Likewise, shares fell in 2012 (along with those of peer Informatica) when Amazon unveiled Redshift, replete with aggressive pricing and big performance promises.
    • NoSQL, often used in big data projects, can deliver better scalability and support more data formats than conventional SQL databases (such as those used in Teradata's projects), albeit at the cost of data consistency.
    • JMP: "While we acknowledge that Teradata is not an 'expensive' stock, we simply believe that the 'price per terabyte' trendline is downward sloping and that Teradata may struggle to grow."
    • Shares dove last month after Teradata offered a full-year guidance cut to go with a Q1 beat.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:26 AM
  • GECC

    Full Circle co-CEOs buyers amid equity raise

    • Gregg Felton was a buyer of 116.35K shares on June 19 at $7.40 each, and John Stewart picked up 5K shares at the same price.
    • The June 19 private placement was for 1.35M shares.
    • FULL +2.1%
     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM

  • Homebuilders boosted by strong sales report

    • Homebuilders (ITB +1%), (XHB +0.7%) are on the rise early after existing home sales rise 4.9% to a seasonally-adjusted rate of 4.89M in May, ahead of expectations for 4.75M.
    • The 4.9% monthly gain was the fastest rise since August 2011, but the 4.89M pace is 5% lower than a year ago.
    • The NAR's Larry Yun notes slower price growth thanks to rising inventory along with a downtick in mortgage rates as boosting business.
    • Total housing inventory of 2.28M homes for sale is a 5.6 month supply at the current sales pace, down from 5.7 months in April, but 6% higher than a year ago.
    • The median home price of $213.4K is 5.1% higher than a year ago. Distressed home sales of 11% falls from 18%.
    • The percent of first-time homebuyers continues to disappoint, down to 27% in May from 29% in April and 29% a year before that.
    • Full report
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 6 Comments
  • NSPH

    Nanosphere inks deal with HealthTrust

    • Shares of Nanosphere (NSPH +19.7%) jump on heavy volume in response to its agreement with HealthTrust that offers access to its molecular diagnostic tests to 1,400 acute care facilities. No financial terms or sales projections are disclosed. The agreement became effective on June 1, 2014.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • AMD

    AMD, Nvidia hit by Pac Crest downgrades

    • Pac Crest has downgraded GPU archrivals AMD (AMD -3%) and Nvidia (NVDA -2%) to Underperform. The firm cites checks that point to weak motherboard production and a major Q/Q drop in high-end graphics card shipments.
    • Digitimes recently reported global graphics card shipments (not the same as end-user demand) were set to fall 30%-40% Q/Q in Q2 due to high inventories, and that AMD/Nvidia were responding by cutting shipments rather than prices.
    • Separately, AMD has unveiled the FirePro W8100, a workstation card that support 8GB of GDDR5 RAM and 2.1 teraflops of double precision compute performance. A flagship card (the FirePro W9100) supporting 2.62 teraflops of double precision compute performance was launched in April.
    • The W8100 launch comes shortly after AMD said it would direct more resources towards FirePro going forward. Nvidia's Quadro GPU line currently towers over the workstation market.
    • BofA/Merrill downgraded Nvidia last week.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 7 Comments
  • HERO

    Hercules Offshore downgraded to Sell at Goldman

    • Hercules Offshore (HERO -3.2%) extends Friday's 11.7% loss after Goldman Sachs downgrades shares to Sell and cuts its price target to $3.60 from $4.60, citing weakening fundamentals after the company announced the contract cancellation for two jack-ups.
    • Goldman also lowers its 2014-15 EBITDA by 25% and 13%, respectively, as the contract cancellation jeopardizes ~$300M of revenues modeled for the next three years; while Friday’s fall somewhat reflects this news, it doesn’t fully incorporate weakening near-to-medium term fundamentals.
    • HERO’s Gulf of Mexico based jack-up fleet will continue to face utilization challenges owing to hurricane season, customer consolidation and likely influx of rigs from Mexico, the firm adds.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 5 Comments
  • SFBS

    ServisFirst boosted after coverage initiation

    • ServisFirst Bancshares (SFBS +2.7%) puts in a sizable early gain after being started at Buy with $105 price target at Sandler O'Neill.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • MTOR

    More on the Meritor-Eaton settlement

    • Shares of Meritor (NYSE:MTOR) are sharply lower after the company announces it settled its case against Eaton.
    • Traders note expectations for the settlement ran ahead of the actual net proceeds amount.
    • MTOR -13.0% premarket to $12.70, while Eaton (NYSE:ETN) is up 2.9% with the settlement overhang removed.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 1 Comment

  • Premarket Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: NSPH +17%. TEG +12%. CENT +11%. PLXT +10%. CORI +10%. RGSE +8%. AZC +7%. CRIS +7%. RMTI +6%. SQNM +5%.
    • Losers: OTC:PRKR -34%. MTOR -13%. ARTX -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 3 Comments
  • ICLD

    InterCloud +3%; company joining Russell microcap index

    • InterCloud (NASDAQ:ICLD) will be added to the Russell Microcap Index on June 27. Funds linked to the index will have to purchase shares.
    • Previous: InterCloud jumps after becoming VMware partner
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM
  • PRKR

    ParkerVision -34.1% before getting halted; news pending

    • ParkerVision (OTC:PRKR) shares were crushed prior to a halt for pending news.
    • A major hearing related to the company's Qualcomm suit was held on May 1.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:09 AM
  • AZC

    Augusta Resources accepts latest HudBay acquisition offer

    • Augusta Resources (NYSEMKT:AZC) +5.7% premarket after accepting a revised takeover offer from HudBay Minerals (NYSE:HBM).
    • The revised offer is worth ~C$555M, or $3.56/share; HBM is offering 0.315 of its shares for each AZC share, the same as its initial hostile bid, but it is now adding 0.17 of a warrant for each AZC share to facilitate a friendly deal.
    • The deal gives HBM the Rosemont project in Arizona, one of the world’s most promising undeveloped copper deposits, with 7B lbs. of copper reserves and resources.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • LULU

    Lululemon on the move with founder stirring the pot

    • Shares of Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) are active in the premarket session after founder Chip Wilson makes some noise about gaining more control of the company.
    • Wilson has been vocal about getting the company to return back to its roots of focusing on core product.
    • LULU +5.6% premarket to $42.50.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM | 4 Comments
  • RBYCF

    Rubicon Minerals +5.2% on initial infill drilling program results

    • Rubicon Minerals (RBY) +5.2% premarket after reporting results for its infill drilling program continue to increase confidence in the F2 deposit at the Phoenix gold project in Ontario.
    • RBY says it plans to complete 38K meters of infill drilling in 2014, with the primary purpose of converting inferred mineral resource ounces to the drill indicated category; RBY says it has completed 39 holes for 7,047 meters of drilling from the program as of May 31.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • BURL

    Burlington Stores tapped by Goldman Sachs for gains

    • Goldman Sachs upgrades Burlington Stores (NYSE:BURL) to a Buy rating from Neutral.
    • The off-price retailer is in the middle of a strategic transformation that could yield positive results, notes Goldman.
    • The investment firm has a price target of $37 on Burlington.
    • BURL +4.4% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:17 AM
  • MCRS

    Oracle to acquire Micros for $5.3B

    • Earlier rumors had Micros (NASDAQ:MCRS) going for about $5B, and final deal for $5.3B works out to $68 per share.
    • The purchase is expected to be immediately accretive to Oracle's non-GAAP earnings and to "expand over time," says Oracle CFO Safra Catz.
    • MCRS +2.2% premarket to $67.20. ORCL +0.3%.
    • Previously: Bloomberg: Oracle close to buying Micros for ~$5B
     
     
     
     
    | 8:16 AM
  • COCO

    Corinthian Colleges strikes deal with DOE, shares +31.7%

    • Corinthian Colleges (NASDAQ:COCO) announces it reached an agreement in principle with the DOE on a transition plan.
    • The deal will see Corinithian engage a business monitor with full access to its records.
    • Corinithian will receive $16M in federal student aid money right away.
    • COCO +31.7% premarket
     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • FMC

    FMC cuts earnings outlook for Q2, FY 2014

    • FMC Corp. (NYSE:FMC) -2.3% premarket issues downside guidance for Q2 and FY 2014, as North American weather conditions that delayed Q1 sales persisted later into Q2 than expected, leading to reduced application of pre-emergent products.
    • FMC sees adjusted EPS for the full year at $4.10-$4.30 vs. $4.35-$4.55 prior guidance and $4.44 analyst consensus estimate, and expects Q2 EPS of $0.95-$1.05 vs. $1.11 consensus.
    • In addition to weather factors, FMC says drought conditions that dragged down sugarcane sales in Brazil continued through Q2, leading to growers cutting back in use of crop protection products such as herbicides and insecticides, and a fall in replanting rates.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:57 AM
  • RIG

    Transocean Partners files $350M IPO of common units

    • Transocean Partners, the MLP formed by Transocean (NYSE:RIG), files for its IPO; it will look to sell up to $350M in common units, although the number of units to be sold under the offering is not specified.
    • Transocean Partners says its initial assets consist of 51% interest in rig companies that own and operate three ultra-deepwater drilling rigs operating in the Gulf of Mexico, while RIG owns the remaining 49% stake; it plans to list its shares on the NYSE under the symbol RIGP.
    • RIG +2% premarket.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:41 AM | 2 Comments
  • LULU

    Lululemon founder makes noise over gaining more control

    • Lululemon (NASDAQ:LULU) founder Chip Wilson is in talks with Goldman Sachs over constructing a strategy to gain more control at the company, according to The Wall Street Journal.
    • Options for Wilson include starting a proxy fight to gain more board seats or finding a P-E partner for a buyout.
    • LULU +1.9% premarket
